meanings.definition: A person who tunes musical instruments.
meanings.sent1: The tuner carefully adjusted the strings on the guitar.
meanings.sent2: The violin tuner made sure each note sounded perfect.
meanings.sent3: The tuner joked that even the piano needed a little tune-up.
meanings.sent4: She was a tuner, harmonizing the orchestra with precision.
meanings.sent5: The tuner's skilled hands brought melody to the silent piano.

meanings.definition: A device used to adjust the frequency of a radio or television receiver.
meanings.sent1: Dad used the tuner to find his favorite radio station.
meanings.sent2: The TV tuner helped improve the picture quality.
meanings.sent3: The tuner beeped happily when it found a clear signal.
meanings.sent4: The tuner was like a wizard, magically fixing the fuzzy channels.
meanings.sent5: With a twist of the tuner, the radio came to life with music.

meanings.definition: A person who adjusts or calibrates machinery or equipment.
meanings.sent1: The machine tuner ensured all parts were working smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The expert tuner fine-tuned the engine for optimal performance.
meanings.sent3: The tuner playfully compared fixing machines to solving puzzles.
meanings.sent4: He was a tuner of gears, making sure everything meshed perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The tuner's precision turned the noisy factory into a symphony of efficiency.
